review_title: Poor work life balance, poor benefits and pay
job_title: Physical Therapist in Orange City, FL
pros: Excellent continuing education benefits and mentorships offered
cons: 21 days of paid time off to start includes ALL holidays, personal days, sick days. Clinics do not close for major holidays unless they fall Monday-Friday. When I left, my insurance deductible was $3000, out of pocket max $6,000 after paying over $200 PER CHECK to add just my husband to my medical. Significant issues with patients being scheduled inappropriately especially delegation to PTA's and found management to be unsupportive of clinician recommendations- my understanding is that they're having a difficult time recruiting front desk personnel due to poor pay and so they limit expectations. They currently offer PRN/contract and traveling positions. Would recommend working there in a temp position to get a full understanding of work environment (it varies by location) before you commit to full time.

pros: While working at Brooks in the outpatient setting, I gained a large amount of experience working with individuals with a wide range of disorders. They also provide many resources to use for therapy, which was very beneficial as a CF. In addition, my CF supervisor was amazingly supportive and helpful. Plus, there were many other SLPs to collaborate and bounce ideas off of. I enjoyed the opportunity to co-treat with OT/PT as well.
cons: SO OVERWORKED!!!! While I learned A LOT working with such a diverse caseload, I felt I never had enough time to really get good at a specific area of our scope of practice. I never knew what to expect when I got to work each day, which was tough as a CF rather than a seasoned therapist. I worked NONSTOP on paperwork. The service model of Brooks is based on how a PT functions, not ST. SLPs are expected to finish writing patients' POCs within the hour we are allotted to administer assessments, as PTs are able to - at the latest all paperwork was due within three days. Overall, they overwork you at Brooks leading to an extremely poor work-life balance. If you want to put yourself through the ringer to learn a little about a lot of things and put your personal life on hold, Brooks is your place. Also horrible about PTO or even the ability to go to a doctors appt.

pros: Unfortunately, I don't have a single pro other than they are one of the better rehabs in the area.
cons: - work culture - reputation in the area for lower pay

pros:
Sometimes friendly environment depending on the day and everyone's mood.
Patients can be nice sometimes but most times not.
cons:
Horrible Management - none of the higher ups have any degrees and little to NONE clinical experience. Most of the time, they don't even know how to handle situations properly, so employees are forced to figure it all out for themselves. Management will also lie about raises and never even give you it. Management constantly lies to you about anything and everything, so be cautious and take everything with a grain of salt since they truly do not care about their employees.
Horrible Pay (new hires typically get paid more than individuals that have been working there for years & management tries to lie about it)
Employees are constantly talking bad about each other and no one seems to get along with anyone
The company will take advantage of your kindness immediately. If you say you can work an extra shift, it becomes expected of you to pick up extra work and then management gets mad if you go into overtime. 
CHECK YOUR PAYSTUBS. They will constantly underpay you and take money out of your checks and will not resolve the issue unless you threaten legal actions. 
You get a "30 min" lunch that you are expected to work through, so you really don't have any personal time. 
Overall, the worst company that I have ever worked for.

pros: Benefits, Work life balance Paid bereavement leave

review_title: used to be a great place to work
pros: The patients and residents are amazing
cons: Ever since they changed the leadership structure when Michael Spigel left, things have really gone down hill. It's all about the bottom line and not even close to being about doing what's best for the patients. Staff are abused no matter what level they are, overworked and not appreciated in the slightest.

job_title: Case Manager in Fernandina Beach, FL
pros: They paid for our Covid vaccinations
cons:
Where
Do I start. I was so excited to get a job with Brooks Rehabilitation Home Health! I thought with a big company, they would have their crap together! But I was wrong. You have office staff in managerial positions, but yet they can’t even do your job! How are you supposed to have faith in your manager when they have no clue what you’re talking about? You never know how many patients you will have on your tablet! If you are managers pet, you will get the days off you want and other perks like which holiday you have to work! The managers will yell at you and treat to like a child, but go back and try to get you to work extra patients. They have “ice cream socials” which is more about the office employees, because the clinicians out actually seeing patients do not have time to stop by! And let’s not forget, I was out for two weeks with covid. I had seen a covid patient 5 days before my first symptom. Brooks told me their was NO WAY for me to prove contact tracing!! But, let the office staff have a potential of exposure and they work from home. I had to take my own PTO to get a check at all!

pros: Rewarding to provide access for patients to high-quality rehabilitation

pros: This job will allow you to appreciate your next job much more after you leave.
cons:
Brooks operates as a company that plans on high turnover rate and it shows.  The salary for physical therapists is the lowest of any competing company in the region.  
The productivity standards in outpatient orthopedic care is unsustainable and the amount of work it takes to get a small bonus is insulting.
During Covid they have completely pulled all bonuses, raises, 401k matching and continuing education.
Impossible to get time off, if you want it you better schedule it 4 months in advance and it will only be approved if a float can cover.
Contracted COVID at work and was required to use paid time off during my quarantine, when I did not have enough PTO, they took it out of my pay.
The non-patient facing senior management received Covid vaccinations prior to any of the outpatient staff.  
Pay and raises are abysmal.
I was "repurposed" during Covid, performing home health and they did not reimburse for mileage (furthest client was 40 miles from home clinic).
One option for health insurance and it is very expensive with a high deductible. 
 This place made me reconsider my entire career choice.

pros: It has been wonderful to work for a not for profit organization. We have scholarship funds that are available for those who have no insurance or limited insurance coverage for therapy. In addition, Brooks offers CEU coverage in house to continue training in specific treatment areas for their employees.
cons: In a large network of outpatient facilities, one would expect better communication between clinics and divisions. The front desk is overworked which puts much of scheduling and authorization questions on the therapists who are already busy with treatment and evaluations. The department who obtains authorizations are understaffed. It seems to take much too long for children and adults to obtain authorization for continued services. This puts delays in progress for patients.

review_title: The absolute worse employer I have ever worked for in my entire time working in the medical field!!!
job_title: CNA/Home Health Aide in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The patients were the absolute best. Receiving weekly pay was a plus but the rate of pay was nothing more than a few cents above minimum wages and the management at custom care treated you as if you were enslaved to them!!
cons: The management continuously changed at custom care and each new manager was less experienced than the previous one. The line of communication was basically null & void as you don't have a voice with them, they are never wrong and will never ever admit to a mistake. The way in which you are spoken to is disrespectful and outright nonprofessional.

review_title: Awful management! Poor benefits and low pay
pros: Coworkers, job opportunities and patients.
cons: Poor dishonest , non supportive management, greedy company. Used to be a great place to work until about 7 years ago with a reorganization. High stress for numbers in admission, the rt diagnosis, the rt pay or, the right facility whichever one has the lowest numbers at the time. Numbers, numbers, numbers!  All dept mtg about numbers and what you are not doing. No positive feedback just negative.. Lots of favoritism in admissions. High stress job. You have to use your personal cell phone and car to drive all over town. Substandard pay not competitive to other company nurse liaisons. Expensive family medical. Management has run this company in the ground!

pros: Good reputation in community quickly being run into the ground by current mgmt
cons: Poor mgmt. bullying by management. Lack of support from mgmt. dishonest company. High pressure/stress to make unrealistic numbers for 3 facilities soon to be 4. Not enough help. Poor pay/benefits, favoritism. No positive reinforcement only negative. It is like being beaten with a whip every day. No respect. Treated like work horse. No empathy or kindness toward employee ur just a body to bring in numbers/patients. Greedy. Greedy Greedy. Mgmt has run this once family oriented employer into the ground. Such a shame

pros: Management has annual meetings with each clinic that I believe are very important for growth and change. Appreciated incentives to achieve satisfactory patient outcomes.
cons: Closed down an outpatient clinic and let go of a former boss which was very poorly handled by the management in my opinion, especially the lack of communication and what would happen next for the rest of the staff.

review_title: Mission Driven, Great Culture, and Company
pros: Company is very mission driven with flexible schedule for work-life balance. Company is the only post-acute rehab hospital in the region with unprecedented reputation in the community due to great patient care and robust community programming. Culture and teammates are great with opportunities for professional growth.
cons: Could have better benefit package, competitive pay, and larger teams to manage workload

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Jacksonville, FL
pros: A lot of fun Volunteer and Events you can get involved in.
cons: Doesn’t pay well, one of the lowest paying companies in healthcare. CNAs are expected to do so much work and aren’t paid what they deserve. PRN hourly wage is the lowest. Management is only concerned about their pockets and the company budget. CNAs are hardly ever recognized for the work they do, if they are, it’s because of favoritism.

pros: Autonomy, excellence in management ended with Brooks Merger. Great training, continuing education, excellent retirement, good health insurance. All good except poor choice for managers as of late.
